IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Attachments Include: 89B - Death Investigation Form Digital Photographs uploaded to Veripic only. Scene Processing: EMS Personnel from the Allegany County Emergency Services responded to the scene, prior to my arrival. Life saving measures were performed prior to my arrival. ( EMS Run #23012267) The victim was prounounced deceased at 1330 hours by Steve Corioni. Death notification was made by EMS personnel to the family on scene. I observed the deceased to be laying on his back in the bathroom of the residence in between the bath tub and sink/toilet area. Digital photographs were taken of the victim and I completed a MSP form 89B (Death Investigation Form). Narrative: On 03/14/2023 at 1331 hours I, TFC DeMoss of the Maryland State Police Cumberland Barracks, was dispatched to the address of 11707 Crocus Ave, Cumberland Maryland 21502 for an unattended death. I arrived on scene and made contact with Allegany County Emergency Services in reference to the incident. I was informed the deceased was declared at 1330 hours by Steve Corioni and had passed from natural causes. Inside of the residence I made contact with the wife of the deceased, Phyllis Morgan who stated she was in the dining room area when her husband, Charles Morgan Jr, went into the bathroom to get a shower. Phyllis Morgan heard her husband call out for help and she entered the bathroom to find him standing over the bathtub with his hands on the side to maintain his balance. Phyllis Morgan was unable to assist him and had her grandson, Dylan Morgan, exit the house to get the assistance of the at-home care nurse Brittney Hansford, employed by UPMC Western Maryland. Dylan Morgan and Hansford responded to Charles Morgan who became unresponsive with his body slumped over the side of the bathtub. Dylan Morgan and Hansford laid Charles Morgan prone on the floor and Hansford began CPR while Phyllis Morgan contacted emergency services. EMS arrived and continued CPR on Charles Morgan until announcing the time of death to be 1330 hours. Phyllis Morgan stated that Charles Morgan had significant health problems including respiratory issues, kidney failure, diabetes, cardiac issues,acute kidney injury, and hypertension. Phyllis Morgan stated that Charles Morgan was on a significant amount of medication and at his recent doctors visit he was being prepared for end of life procedures. Charles Morgan was prescribed the following medications: Lisinopril 10 mg Nifedipine XL: 40mg Hydralazine: 150 mg Furosemide: 20mg Clopidogrel Bisulfate: 75mg Isosorbide Mononitrate: 60mg Thiamine: 100mg Tamsulosin Hcl: 0.4 mg Tiotropium Bromide: 2 Inhalations daily Mometason: 2 inhalations daily Atorvastatin Calcium: 20mg Levetiracetam: 500mg Aspirin: 81mg Insulin Glargine: 15 unit Insulin Apart inj: 5 units Carvedilol: 12.5 mg I entered the bathroom of the residence and observed Charles Morgan lying prone in the center of the room between the bathtub and the sink/toilet. Charles Morgan was naked at this time. I observed no prescribed medication, or controlled dangerous substances in the area. Digital photographs were taken of the scene and uploaded to VeriPic. It did not appear foul play was involved. Upon examination of the deceased, there was no lividity present, slight rigor mortis, and the body was warm to the touch. The temperature of the environment was warm, approximately in the high 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The medical examiners office was contacted and Fawn Gerhard of the Medical Examiners Office was contact via telephone. (ME Case Number 22-3418) Ceclia Trent of the Veterans Administration doctors office was contacted and agreed to sign off on the death certificate. The body was recovered by Scarpellis Funeral Home where the body was located. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland.
